website_summaries.verdict: Top choice for hikers and travelers. Filtration straw removes harmful bacteria and protozoa from natural and tap water sources.
pros: Ideal for backpackers and overseas travelers as an alternative to chemical or pump purification
No wait time and no funny aftertaste
cons: Both water bottle and replacement filters are expensive
Drinking through filtration straw takes some effort

customer_reviews.title: He had a different kind of filter and he was fine, but I got sicker than a dog
customer_reviews.text: A friend and I drank from the same well. He had a different kind of filter and he was fine, but I got sicker than a dog.
customer_reviews.author: If can can

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Bought this two pack for my wife and I before going to travel internationally; however, we assumed that the bottle was air tight like a normal water bottle, that was not the case. Multiple times and after multiple attempts of trouble shooting the both bottles leaked from the sides and/tops. The first time around soaking everything in my pack which killed my portable charger, some trinkets, and my passport. The bottles look cool and I hope the water filters worked properly but this was a very disappointing and in the end costly purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Not what it says it is.
customer_reviews.text: It says in the advertisement that it filters 1000 liters... but only part of it does. You then have to buy extra (and expensive) carbon filters for every 100 liters. Not cool to advertise that way. Be up front.
customer_reviews.author: Adel

customer_reviews.title: LifeStraw is terrific! I traveled to India for two weeks and ...
customer_reviews.text: LifeStraw is terrific! I traveled to India for two weeks and didn't get Delhi Belly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke on third use
customer_reviews.text: Horrible customer service sent me to the product replacement page to purchase a new lid. Purchased for our trip to Europe. What a pain to have it break on our second day there. We couldn't even use it to hold water and pour switch lids with another bottle. The lid leaks when the straw is in closed position and doesn't seal when straw is in open position so no water flows through. A piece of lid under the filter is actually broken and they won't replace it. Horrible product and customer service for this high price point.
customer_reviews.author: C.Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Life Straw water bottles leak!  Comparison shop for a better filtered water bottle.
customer_reviews.text: Filtered water bottles are great, but LifeStraw bottles leak. I used for 3 weeks and have leaking through top and side. Unfortunately, the first time I discovered this, the bottle was in a backpack on a hiking trip and all clothes, items were soaked. I contacted the company twice to request exchange, but the company did not respond to multiple emails. You can find a better item than this for $40.
customer_reviews.author: SDM

customer_reviews.title: I survived Cuba with this awesome bottle
customer_reviews.text: I was sooooo hesitant to use this product in Cuba... but it worked like a gem! I didn’t get sick, so the filter must have worked as promised. The only reason I gave it a 4/5 is because the mouth piece leaks of it isn’t pushed in with force which was unfortunate. Luckily it wasn’t a ton on water- only the water that was already sucked into the straw from the last use. Other than that- it was fantastic, the water didn’t taste bad, like dirt, chlorine or anything unpleasant (my friends each had a different branded filter bottles and their water tasted horrible)
customer_reviews.author: Jean Sifrit-Reed

customer_reviews.title: Leaky Bottle
customer_reviews.text: I was slightly disappointed with the water bottle. For the price, I really think it should be better. I used this during fieldwork in rural Nicaragua, and needed the filtration. The filter worked fine, and the bottle was okay, but if the bottle tipped over it would leak. My friend had the same bottle down there, and had the same thing happen to hers. We were slightly annoyed because it cost so much to have our precious water (walking miles per day) leak when our backpacks tipped over. If you don't mind keeping the bottle upright, it might be good for you. Although, mine even leaked on the airplane and soaked my bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work as described
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 2 stage filter in hopes that the carbon filter would reduce the chlorine taste in my tap water, as the lifestraw website claimed it would. I'm not sure if I have a defective carbon filter or if it is just plastic for show. This thing did nothing at all to reduce chlorine, at all. I thought I would try this one out since it was a few dollars cheaper than the Sawyer. The Sawyer that I bought works great. Maybe if you are using it to purify lake water on a hike it would be worth it, but after false claims about chlorine, I wouldn't put blind faith in lifestraw.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Garbage product. never even had a chance to use it. I filled it up with regular plain tap water and put it in refrigerator to get cold. When I took it out it was impossible to suck threw the filter. Company said that you can't put cold liquids into it and refused to stand by it. If you're planning on using this from a cold stream find another solution. They advertise that the filter lasts 5 years. Mine didn't last 5 hours.
customer_reviews.author: David Oakley

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy - LEAKS CONSTANTLY EVEN WHEN UPRIGHT
customer_reviews.text: This was a total waste of money. The bottle leaks constantly - even when hanging upright on the outside of my backback. I have tried it several times - each time I wind up with no water and soaking wet clothing or bags. For $35 I expected so much more. I wish I could have returned it. I wanted so much to love it, and would have settled for at least having it be functional. Alas, it leaks so completely that it may as well be an open Dixie cup for how useful it is.
customer_reviews.author: California Crafter

customer_reviews.title: Leaky lids
customer_reviews.text: What is the point of having a lid that allows the fluid to leak from the bottle if it's not always upright? Seriously... 30 years ago we were envisioning flying cars in 2020, yet here we are and we haven't even mastered the lid for a $30 water bottle? We are doomed. The filter is otherwise pretty nifty.
customer_reviews.author: boomshakaday

customer_reviews.title: Annoying to use
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: I ended up returning this. It gave off a very unpleasant chemical taste after a couple of uses. Nice concept but needs more work. I wanted to love this. I'm really picky about water and thought this would be great for my travels. I travel for work so would be using it a lot. The water tastes fine with it but the issue is the amount of sucking power you have to use to actually get it to work. Like a crazy amount of sucking! I thought perhaps the straw was blocked but it's not. I won't be using it again and my search for an alternative continues.
customer_reviews.author: Siobhan E

customer_reviews.title: Got sick from the water.
customer_reviews.text: I drank one bottle full from a creek way up high in the Colorado Rockies. Got bad sick. Had to take antibiotics. Can’t gaurantee it was from this but can’t think of anything else that could have caused it. Won’t risk it again! Returning.
customer_reviews.author: seadoobie

customer_reviews.title: TAINTED ITEMS SOLD DIRECTLZY FROM AMAZON
customer_reviews.text: My shipment containing this water bottle. Tracking number ending in 666! Arrived today... This water bottle was obviously tainted because i bought two of them at different times. The first one arrived with seals intact and perfectly clean. The other one arrived about a week late with dog hairs and a bunch of spit inside as well as broken seals. Perhaps not the fault of the bottle manufacturer but someone at amazon clearly deliberately tainted this package...
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Clean water through a dirty straw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for some of my extended hiking/climbing trips. Although the water may be clean, the straw part is not. Dirt and debris constantly got all around the straw and the bottle doesn't hold much water at all. I'm better off putting my Lifestraw in my regular water bottle. Update: I filled up the bottle and accidentally dropped it on my kitchen floor, about 4 feet. The bottom cracked open and now I just have a life straw filter. This thing was not made for adventures!
customer_reviews.author: dana

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver for Someone with MAC Lung Infection
customer_reviews.text: The LifeStraw filter system is one of very few that removes mycobacterium from drinking water. I've recently been diagnosed with mycobacterium avium complex (MAC) lung infection, and this bottle has become a critical part of the tools I now use to keep my exposure to the bacteria as close to zero as possible. It's easy to fill, easy to clean, easy to use. I take it to restaurants and just dump their water into it, and no more worries about contaminated water or ice. Not everybody is at risk from MAC infection, but if even if you're not, why drink it if you can avoid it? So glad to have found this bottle!
customer_reviews.author: Laureltn

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel and home
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite travel items! I recommended this to my travel clients. I use this while traveling on cruise ships and avoid paying for water. Also used it Europe and Mexico. Water taste great. It is currently on desk because after experiencing the taste while traveling I had to have it at work as well. It is pricey but well worth it. You can TASTE the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Warner

customer_reviews.title: Went to CUBA with these
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I visited Cuba with these bottles. Had no issues whatsoever and could drink the water directly from the tap by filtering with these. The flavor is SUPERB. I'd rather drink from these all the time instead of bottled or filtered water. However, its too expensive to do that. Save it for when its really needed. Drinking from it, you do have to ... suck... quite a bit. But honestly, its not that big an issue. You get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Rummy

customer_reviews.title: Life Straw Bottles
customer_reviews.text: So at first I was very nervous about how well this was going to work. After being on the river in the middle of bfe with no one around for 4 days I can proudly say they work very well. After drinking the water from the river with this bottle I didn't have any symptoms appear. I highly recommend to get this product.
customer_reviews.author: Harlie

customer_reviews.title: BEST filtered water bottle you can get!
customer_reviews.text: This water bottle is AMAZING! I hunt and camp regularly, as long as I have this on my backpack and have a source of running water I NEVER go thirsty. I have spent 7 days in the mountains with this bottle as my only means of drinking water and it worked flawlessly. Really helps taking any bad taste out and I never once got sick from any bacteria. I have a lifestraw as well but the lifestraw bottle is so much more convenient. Wether you’re a hunter, hiker, prepper or weekend warrior, this is a must have!
customer_reviews.author: ExploreColorado

customer_reviews.title: Great when you need it, but not for daily use
customer_reviews.text: Well, I didn't get sick in a 3rd world country. That's the biggest concern! However, there's a few things I would improve. First, the bottles are heavy. I suppose that's due to the life-saving filter. My other gripe was how difficult it was to suck water out. Again, this is probably due to the filter, but it really started to drive me crazy by the end of my trip. All in all, I'm grateful for how wonderful this was at filtering tap water in a location where finding bottled water was difficult. I wouldn't use this daily at home, but it saved us when we needed water.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I have used it for a month on the road and like it a lot. I use it mostly traveling abroad and even though the water is supposed to be filtered I have gotten sick before....( Mexico, China, Vietnam, Indonesia, etc. ) I just empty my bottled water or water from the tap and drink up. Not a single issue with bad water so far. It works great and would recommend...much easier than a life straw. I have the pitcher as well but this is very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: breeze90265

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe the bad reviews...
customer_reviews.text: I used this for international travel, filled it with the contaminated tap water and did not get sick. It does take quite awhile for the filter to become saturated enough to easily drink out of it, but that is stated on the instructions that come with the bottle. I was worried about buying this bc of all the bad reviews. However, I wonder if those writing the bad reviews didn't bother reading the instructions. The longer I used it, easier it was to use. I would highly recommend this bottle for travel anywhere that potable water isn't readily available.
customer_reviews.author: aroe

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty incredible. If you know a fisherman who spends hours on the water (fly or boat), this is a GREAT gift. I bought for a backcountry hiking trip, and realized that while it is great for that, the true value is saving me from carring water (or regretting I didn't) on fly fishing trips. Wading in the stream all day can get tiring, and being able to just dip your filter bottle in for a quick/cool drink is awesome. I put duct tape around the bottle to help with abrasion while hiking/fishing, but overall a fantastic product!
customer_reviews.author: MJF

customer_reviews.title: Toxic taste you can't get rid of, do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Cannot get the toxic chemical taste out of the filtered water even after soaking and cycling it through about 10 times! Please Lifestraw tell me how to get this horrible taste out of the water coming up through the straw. Or please send me a different one that doesn't taste like I'm poisoning myself. Or just refund my money. Seriously took me hours to get the gross taste out of my mouth. Do not buy this product unless you want to drink your water sucked through a toxic poisonous filter. Why are there so many good reviews, I don't get it? Total waste of your hard earned $$$!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Miraculous bottles!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Bought for a trip to China. My 12 year old son opened the package, disassembled and cleaned the bottles. We tested them (after removing the clear plastic wrapper from the mouthpiece; do people really not know you need to remove this wrapping!? Seemed obvious). Great suction; like any other bottle. The seals around the lid are very tight. No leaking. Great taste. Will update when we return!
customer_reviews.author: RHC

customer_reviews.title: Take It Everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Recent trip to South America and my Lifestraw saved me! I drink a lot of water and found that I could fill up my bottle in my hotel room in Chile, and it tasted great! I even filtered the bottled water in Buenos Aires to assure I would not get sick. Everyone was impressed with my Lifestraw, and I recommended it to everyone! Even the locals wanted to know how to get one! My son took his to an area in Mexico where no one drinks the water. He did and never got sick! Thanks Lifestraw, for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Vickey W-F

customer_reviews.title: Bad design
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for traveling abroad. Cons: 1. Carabiner ring attached to bottle. When I try to refill, I have to unlatch from my backpack, hold the lid-straw in my mouth, use my other hand to work the faucet. 2. On the plane, the pressure change (especially during landing) causes water to shoot up the mouthpiece 3. After using, I'd disassemble to dry parts. After a day, straw still wet 4. When cleaning, how to back flush in order to dislodge contamination on the filter? 5. Might not be fair test. Did not filter out green food coloring
customer_reviews.author: Derrik L.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for CDMX
customer_reviews.text: First - definitely remove that plastic on the mouthpiece as described in other reviews. Second - this is a decent-looking, medium sized water bottle with filtration that keep me illness-free during a trip to Mexico City. Mind you, I wasn't dipping it into streams or anything like that, but it made me feel a lot more confident when filling out of anything other than a water filtration unit (which I also used). I would recommend it overall.
customer_reviews.author: DeathBeforeDecaf

customer_reviews.title: Love this lifestraw!
customer_reviews.text: I just got back from a backpacking trip and used this while hiking and camping and it was amazing. The water tasted great, I'm not sick from any bacteria, it helped save weight as we could fill up as we went instead of carrying all the water with us. I would highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Kiefer

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Purchase All Time
customer_reviews.text: I love this water bottle. I lost my original in my move so bought a new one. Would’ve only replaced the filter had I found the old one. People are paying this much for sippy water bottles with logos rather than the filter straw. Go for this one and throw your favorite stickers on instead. You’ll save money in the long run, and will be doing yourself a massive favor of never going without clean water.
customer_reviews.author: MotorCityPal

customer_reviews.title: Squirty
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use it on an air plane...no,no.no. The rubber sucking station, much like the nipple on a baby bottle,, squirted all over me and my seat mate, Oh no...Don't like the nipple sucking water delivery system. Jeez I'm already a 73 year old baby. Can't recommend this product even though I want to, We all need to be ready and able to have clean water, no matter where
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Bad design for dirty environment
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't test how well the filtering works, but this bottle has terrible design. The mouth piece can only fold down when not using. Without any proper cover, it is exposed to dirt during hiking or traveling in rough environment. With dirty mouth piece, the filtering is somewhat meaningless. The difficulty sucking water is annoying, but seems to improve bit by bit over several uses. Inability of using the filtered water to make tea, coffee or other uses is also troublesome.
customer_reviews.author: Fawkes

customer_reviews.title: Only works for 4 days... 👎🏼
customer_reviews.text: Bought these bottles to take on a camping trip in South America. Several members of our group were also using Life Straw bottles. All of our bottles began to leak from the straw when it was in the closed position after 4 days. When camping, hiking, and during outdoor activities it’s really challenging to keep a bottle in the upright position. We were all super frustrated with this product, wondering why any company would promote and such a flawed device. Great idea, bad design! 🤬
customer_reviews.author: Mickirose

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel/hiking!
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful for travel/hiking places where water quality is an issue. Gives you peace of mind if traveling overseas, and would also be great for hikers who may need to drink from streams or something. You do have to use a decent amount of suction to get the straw to work, but it is easier than drinking a thick milkshake. The bottle did drip a teeny bit occasionally, so you do want to store it upright when full. That's the main reason I only gave it 4 stars - it would be nice to be able to throw it in a backpack or tote and be confident it won't leak.
customer_reviews.author: L. T.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive; but good for Water Boil notices...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a week long flood induced water boil notice Austin,TX was recently subjected to. Seemed to work as advertised; as neither of us got sick. I personally wouldn't use this as they advertised... no way I would just fill from a running stream or anything. You do have to be good a sucking... as your mouth suction is the "power" which draws the water thru the two stage filter. I didn't have a real issue doing it... but the wife couldn't seem to bothered to do it often. I personally; think this would be a good product for emergency usage for hurricane alley... but YMMV.
customer_reviews.author: John Zitterkopf

customer_reviews.title: Very effective
customer_reviews.text: Great water bottles. This was my first exposure to the LifeStraw, and I was very satisfied. We collected water from a waterfall while hiking and the resulting drinks were clean, flavorless, and didn't make us ill. You can drink fairly rapidly despite having to suction the water through all the filaments. The carabiner makes it easy to clip anywhere I want to carry it. Other reviews were concerned about the distance between straw and bottom; for me, there was not enough distance to make a difference in its effectiveness. I wouldn't have given it thought if I hadn't seen reviews about it, honestly. I would get this item again.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Casale

customer_reviews.title: I don’t go on vacation without mine now!!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved having these on our Costa Rica trip! While we typically filled them with water from our villa I actually got bored with never being able to use/test them so I poured out my clean water and filled it with river water! There was no floating sediment in my water but it was definitely not crystal clear - and it tasted great and I never ended up sick! We have since taken them to races and camping trips and I am always the one to put them to the test and they always works great!!
customer_reviews.author: jwolfe

customer_reviews.title: Safe, clean drinking water
customer_reviews.text: Used for last 4 months in Costa Rica : mostly in urban area where water sources are "generally" safe but also used for several trips to various beaches and undeveloped wildlife areas. Not one time in 4 months' use did I feel ill, the water always tastes great regardless of the source. The bottle size is big enough that I am not constantly refilling but small enough to pack along on any trip. Maybe the water was always safe to drink....but maybe not. The peace of mind was well worth the cost AND no plastic bottles went into the trash!
customer_reviews.author: Allie Gator

customer_reviews.title: Drinking 3x more water now.
customer_reviews.text: Tap water still tastes a little “tap watery” but there is a notable improvement in the flavor. I notice that there isn’t as much of a chlorine taste in the water after it’s filtered. Not sure why, but on occasion, water will push up through the sip spout which spills down the side. Not sure why that happens. I drink about 3x more water when I carry this bottle with me which is my goal...so mission accomplished. I was surprised how much suction is required to draw water through the filter but I’ve gotten used to it.
customer_reviews.author: D Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, almost love it
customer_reviews.text: This bottle is an awesome concept and it works great. It does leak only when I accidentally over fill it a bit and don't stick to the 600mL indicated line. I'm giving it 4 stars because of bad chlorine taste if I leave the filter in tap water for several hours. Rinsing the filter with bottled water helps with the chlorine taste so I feel that now I need to buy a faucet filter so I don't keep using water bottle water for rinsing. This also doesn't filter viruses so it would not prevent all waterborne illnesses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Water Tastes Disgusting, Like Plastic
customer_reviews.text: Water tasted like plastic with a bitter aftertaste that did not leave my mouth for several minutes. Their website was of NO help with the problem. I rinsed the filters several times and even used filtered water from my refrigerator - the water was still disgusting. Huge disappointment. I wanted to give these as Christmas presents to each of my children.
customer_reviews.author: Edison

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for the traveler
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my girlfriend because she is a regular world traveler and some times she goes places with questionable water. During her trip she would tell me how convenient is was to have the LifeStraw Go. She said people would ask her about it on her travels around the world. Needless to say she absolutely loved traveling with this, and I can't recommend this enough to other people looking for a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: Ravi

customer_reviews.title: Hard to draw though Straw!,,
customer_reviews.text: Like others I have found it very difficult to draw water through the straw. That’s a big thing when one has weakened immune system. Our pump that we bought many years ago works much easier and not hard to replace filters. So still carry it around. Plus we can give water to our dogs. Dogs can get Giaradia same as people and it can get expensive and worse poor dogs get sick. Anyways I wouldn’t buy this instead buy one of the higher ratings or a pump. Wish they’d fix cause the concept is great.
customer_reviews.author: loveinthemist

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one for each member of my family as we were traveling to Belize for a week. The water is supposedly safe in most locations, but not recommended for visitors as it often causes some gastric distress. We each filled the water bottles with tap water, and stored them in the refrigerator overnight so the water would be cold for at least part of the next day. Worked great. Easy to use, easy to carry, easy to refill. It's hard to judge the effectiveness, except that nobody in the family had gastric problems. So I guess it was a success.
customer_reviews.author: RJaff

customer_reviews.title: 6 months bottle
customer_reviews.text: My wife uses this everyday at work, law enforcement and it wont leak, but get scratches real bad , but the filter lasts about 6 months, then they want you to replace the filter which is like $30 or for $40, you get the new bottle and filter, so thats what we do. But overall it wont leak and works nice.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Marker

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you inspect it when you receive it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the lifestraw for a trip I am taking overseas on April 19th. I did not open it until this past weekend to prime it per instructions. I followed the instructions and all looked fine. I filled out the bottles with water and had them sitting on the counter top in the kitchen to use them later on in the day. when I returned to get them, water was all over the kitchen counter top. I inspected the bottles closely with a magnifying glass. both bottles were cracked and leaking!!! Do not make my mistake and wait after you receive them. open and inspect immediately!!!
customer_reviews.author: ALI I.

customer_reviews.title: Cheek & jaw muscles hurt
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended in some travel blog. We hardly used them because it’s extremely difficult to get the water through. I’m so disappointed I spent this much on a product we couldn’t really use. I kept coughing using it because I was trying to suck the water in and breathe after. We bought two and these were a terrible waste of montey for us!
customer_reviews.author: QueenV

customer_reviews.title: perfect for travel
customer_reviews.text: bought this for trip to Caribbean. It was perfect, especially in a place where you want to filter the water. Its now my primary travel water bottle. Its not the cheapest, but in this case you get what you pay for. It is a little harder to drink from at first as it only filters when you are sucking the water out. Clip is nice extra.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: Don’t listen to those reviews of it being hard to suck water out. It’s a filter so you have to suck a little bit harder to move the water through the filter system. It’s not that hard. It’s peace of mind if you travel and the water isn’t clean you just put their water in it, and it filters it for your safety! Worth your health, gives peace of mind, and it’s portable! Win win win!
customer_reviews.author: Seth Harris

customer_reviews.title: Used in Mexico
customer_reviews.text: I get that lifestraw is made for more heavy duty hiking/life survival/camping stuff. But, I bought these for a simple trip to Mexico - hoping to save some $$ on water bottles and avoid montezuma's revenge. I like to drink a lot of water - we planned a lot of sight seeing and one day of hiking. We didn’t stay in a resort - filled the water bottles from our bathroom sink and various water fountains. 7 days later - went home and back to work. Feeling just the same as when we left.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Nothing I expected. Tried drinking from a river and tasted all the nasty water. It filters wood chunks, but definitely not going to save my life.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Relatively fragile cap
customer_reviews.text: About eight months ago I bought my first lifestraw. It seemed to work very well (although unscrewing the top takes more effort than I like), but I dropped it and the mouthpiece disconnected from something so I could not longer draw up water. So five months ago I order a replacement. But this one also dropped on the sidewalk and the end of the mouthpiece thing snapped off (leaving a dangerous sharp edge) and the blue plastic at the tip disintegrated and I don't want to risk swallowing ground plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenient way to filter water on the trail
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to day hike the Enchantments - it's long and difficult with ample sources of water along the way. In particular, I was trying to ease the difficulty by carrying less water and filtering some instead. It works great for that. Otherwise I've used it a couple times and it gets the job done. Fun tip: Pack some coffee grinds and put them in there. The filter will remove the coffee grinds but leave the flavor. If the local water is already cold, you've got a great source of cold brew. The downside is that you'll ONLY have cold brew until you clean it out so you've gotta watch out for caffeinating.
customer_reviews.author: Keith W Trnka

customer_reviews.title: It leaks
customer_reviews.text: If I could get my $50 back, I'd certainly try. It's a great concept and yes, I've saved money and the environment by not buying as many cases of water as before, but the thing leaks. You can't just toss it in the passenger seat of your truck or put it in the drink compartment of your backpack and toss that anywhere, cuz if not absolutely upright, it leaks. ...and it squeaks. When I'm sucking the water up through the straw, it whistles ... or makes a noise.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Although I am happy that I donated to a good cause, I'm not happy with the product. It's too difficult to use the straw- there's strong resistance. I've followed the instructions to soak the filter and use warm water on the bottom part of the straw, but it still isn't working properly. Now, I have to spend more money an the water bottle by Brita to get a water bottle that filters.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Doe not work at all.
customer_reviews.text: This is not working for me at all. First, it takes a village power to suck up the water. Secondly, the water tastes so horrible. I have to return this and continue to find other option for my Mexico trip. The upside is - I was able to return without any issue.
customer_reviews.author: BookToRead

customer_reviews.title: The key is gentle suction.
customer_reviews.text: Used this bottle on a trip to Germany, France, and Switzerland. Extremely convenient way to safely stay hydrated as long as you have access to some source of water. I filled up at various bathroom sinks and water fountains in multiple airports and public transportation stations -- I did not get sick. There is a brief learning period to drinking from this straw, but it is not difficult -- the key is gentle suction. I would not recommend this bottle if you plan to use it when you may be extremely parched or if you tend to always drink voraciously.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compare Prices For Different Colors!
customer_reviews.text: We recently bought two of these for a month-long trip to Central America, and we were very glad we had them. I don't know if another manufacturer makes a comparable product for less, but these work well. Our complaints: 1. They are expensive; 2. Different colors have different prices; 3. They only hold 600 ml.
customer_reviews.author: P. Dershem

customer_reviews.title: Water tastes crisp, clean and fresh!
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews from all over and this bottle has been rated in the very top if not #1 consistently for a few years now. Forget buying any kind of other water jug... this one will filter any bacteria, chlorine or whatever AND the water tastes amazing! I fill mine up halfway with ice cubes then tap water. It is nice to be able to keep your water cold by adding ice and having it filtered.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Most useful product ever!
customer_reviews.text: I used this LifeStraw when I took a trip to West Africa this summer. Although there is plenty of available bottled drinking water to purchase, I decided that I did not want to use the water I actually wanted to drink for also brushing my teeth. I decided to fill my LifeStraw with the hotel's tap water and use that filtered water to brush my teeth. It was a worry free experience the entire time. Totally worth the money in order to have peace of mind. I even used it in Europe too.
customer_reviews.author: Fran S.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Gave five of these to my sister's family at Christmas 2018 for their long-planned summer 2019 trip to Europe. They tested them at home before leaving, luckily, and said these never worked at all. We live in another town and just saw each other so they could give them back to me. I followed instructions that came with product, then watched several YouTube videos - I could NOT get them to work, either. Save your $$.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Gal

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to drink out of
customer_reviews.text: I’m obsessed with smart water and really wanted a reusable water bottle that filtered my water. I was excited until , I got this and experienced how difficult it was to drink out of . It’s a work out to sip water through the mouth piece. Save your money and get cheaper one
customer_reviews.author: Karlie McCallum

customer_reviews.title: Carbon filter plastic cheap
customer_reviews.text: I read the instructions which said to pop out the carbon filter and rinse it prior to first use. Used a coin to try to pop out the filter and the plastic broke. Straw is still usable, but really? Updating review to add my most recent mishap with this company. I happened to misplace one of my bottles but still had the straw. I emailed the company and asked how I could purchase a replacement bottle - and they don't sell or otherwise make available replacement bottles. WHAT? Go with a company that 1)Sells replacements and 2) Doesn't use a cheap made-in-china plastic straw rigging.
customer_reviews.author: llbad

customer_reviews.title: Hard to drink from
customer_reviews.text: While I really like this product and think that it is quite useful. I got this water bottle for my boyfriend for christmas last year so that he could take it with him hiking, unfortunately, the bottle is pretty hard to drink from, the life straw filter part takes up a good amount of the room inside the water bottle and if it's tipped over it leaks literally all over the place which is surprising since its so hard to drink out of. It's useful for what it is but not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kenya E. Green

customer_reviews.title: unable to suck water thru the bottle
customer_reviews.text: I was unable to suck water thru the bottle filter from when it was new. Assume it was simply a defective product will try to return it. the standard lifestraw works fine. was unable to return because the return window closed before we got home from our trip to south america. Waste of $50 Maybe life straw by vestergaard can contact me if they see this posting.
customer_reviews.author: john steichen

customer_reviews.title: Just a water bottle not sure filter does anything
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure how i feel about this water bottle. I thought it would make water from areas taste...cleener. I stay on hotels a lot in cities and towns i am unfamiliar with. I hate drinking water and having funny or strange taste to it. I thought this would filter it get rid of any weird taste....it did not. It is also a little smaller in capacity than most water bottles i used. I just don't love this. I use my camel back a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: Alex and Kelsi Brosnahan

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Great filter, kinda crappy water bottle...
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THE FILTER. Shame mine started leaking almost immediately after use...the little rubber thing that provides the suction leaks. My friend bought one and the same thing happened to her. We still used them on a trip abroad. They give you piece of mind. I would reccomend buying just the LifeStraw and use another water bottle that won't leak. Great product/idea just not figured out yet.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: It has a great filtration tube/system.
customer_reviews.text: It has a great filtration tube/system. It does kind of leak yeah. You gotta be careful. Don't fill it all the way up. I opened it one time and the water came pouring right out of the straw part! Good thing I only fill it up with water. I wish there was more than one size of this water bottle. There's only one size. Good thing it comes in many colors! And you gotta get (if you don't already have one) a bottle cleaner. I already had one. Definitely don't think this bottle deserves only two stars. It's better than that.
customer_reviews.author: Irina

customer_reviews.title: Useful and Versatile!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this for my Mexico trip! Filtered water very nicely. My only issues were AFTER the first use. I rinsed and removed the carbon cap and put it back on as instructed but the water would not come through the straw for another use!!! Not sure what to do or how to fix it but overall it does filter the water.
customer_reviews.author: Jojo Velazquez

customer_reviews.title: beautiful
customer_reviews.text: It is beautiful in appearance and beautiful in general. The quality is good and the weight is just right. Wide skid strip, safety first. It's tasteless and easy to drink. Worth buying, trust JINGdong. Give a five star praise, awesome, beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: Mason Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Suck away but no water
customer_reviews.text: I reached out to Lifestraw and they sent me a replacement (I sent the defective one back). This new one works fine. The one I received must have been a bad apple. Only way to know is to test it before a trip or expedition - you can't tell by looking at it. So keep that in mind before heading out.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Fits my contigo
customer_reviews.text: This water bottle is so great. The delivered bottle was as pictured but I discovered that the top and Filter Fits my 24 oz contigo bottle- the other one is handy but not insulated. the Filter works really great and I can safely drink tap water.
customer_reviews.author: YChilds

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for an international mission trip. They worked great. Only downsides are that they don’t hold much and you really have to work at getting the water out. But that’s understandable since it has a pretty intense filter. You have to replace the smallest part of the filter regularly (3 months?) and the larger part less often. Maybe 6 months? With regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Alex R

customer_reviews.title: Does the job - but with leaks!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this water bottle! I had a life straw before but hated bending over when out hiking or tanning a clean water bottle. This solves that. My only complaints are that it is definitely harder to suck through than most filter bottles and it leaks quite a lot. If you ever have elevation or heat change the water that is still in the filter pipe pushes its way up and out of the top even with the straw is down. Makes for a very leaky experience - which is a bummer since I got it to replace a another brand due to leaks.
customer_reviews.author: musicmanyo

customer_reviews.title: Leaky Waterbottle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bottle to use while in Costa Rica. It was able to filter water very well without leaving a bad aftertaste. The biggest problem I had with it is that it leaks from the top of the bottle where the filter straw and drinking straw connect. While I believe it may be possible to avoid this by making sure the straw is extremely secure in the lid, I did not have success in getting it to stop leaking and neither did my friend with the same bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Sister of 3

customer_reviews.title: Minor annoyances, but works great
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a recent two-week trip through Peru. I normally drink a ton of water, and it was so nice to fill from the tap without buying additional bottled water. When the filter is in place, you do have to suck harder to get water out, and it does squeak sometimes, but both annoyances are a small price to pay for access to water that doesn't make you sick! Since I’ve been home, it’s been my go to bottle (without the filter) because it’s lightweight, easy to carry, and spill-proof.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Leaking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bottle for a trip overseas where water could be questionable. I had no problems with being able to drink out of it, and the water tasted consistent each time. My big complaint is the leaking. I did some hiking, alot of walking, and many times ended up with a wet backpack, and half my water gone. In addition to that when trying to drink on the plane, the bottle when opened was,like a fountain. I am very disappointed in this bottle, and would not be able to recommend this. The filter/ taste is great, but that's it.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy McKenna

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!! LEAKS!!! NO EXCHANGE OR RETURN ALLOWED!
customer_reviews.text: VERY UNHAPPY! DO NOT BUY!!! i bought this item for a long trip to india. decided to take my regular life straw and just keep this for everyday use. came back from my month long trip and found that IT LEAKS! spilled water all over the car and in my purse. amazon wouldn’t allow a return because of the time frame. that’s fine but it was BRAND NEW and a WASTE of money. there was no one to stand by this product. no help w replacement pieces. nothing. i only gave it 1 star bc 0 stars was not an option!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica A. Porras Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Convenience vs. bottled water
customer_reviews.text: When you 1st use this water the taste reminds me of the days as a child when we would drink from a garden hose on a hot Summer day. It's not as bad after you use it a couple times. In the end, totally worth the piece of mind, but, don't expect bottled water taste. By the way, it nice to not have to buy water and throw away yet another piece of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Newingham

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Leaks out from the tope when lifting the straw. Leaks out the sides if you tip the bottle a bit. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: KD's

customer_reviews.title: LifeStraw is a lifesaver for us.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used LifeStraw before as it is a popular bottle for travellers and hikers all over the world and I was SO happy when I found it on Amazon. Got if for travel to DR and, although we’ve changed destination, I know these bottles will go with us everywhere! They are great for airport water and to filter ”bottled” water in countries where bottled water actually is tap water (not first class filtered). Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: UN

customer_reviews.title: This bottle can leak, so don't fill it
customer_reviews.text: While it may offer a great, and simple filtering of your water (and I haven't gotten sick yet!), be careful not to fully fill it. It tends to leak a bit from the top sip portion. This is especially true if you're on an airplane. We both experienced air pressure leaks. Just don't fill the bottle within an inch or two. The bottles are a good size and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have
customer_reviews.text: I love this water bottle. I was able to drink water from essentially anywhere in SE Asia while everyone kept having to purchase bottled water. Sucked not having cold water at times but its ok. This was a great money saver for me while I was backpacking. It did leak at times but nothing to major, Recommend everyone have one of these during their travels. Must Have
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Your mouth will hurt
customer_reviews.text: I hope your not too thirsty. This straw with the filter is extremely hard to drink out of. I did remove the plastic top like you are instructed too but the water still has to be sucked hard to drink. It discourages you from drinking water. That needs to be fixed and now I'm stuck with a plain old water bottle for $30
customer_reviews.author: Johnd87

customer_reviews.title: I carry it everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I work overseas and I find this a great way to stay healthy. Water where I am is not safe and this gives me a higher level of confidence. I'm not a fan the attached clip, but it can be removed. I also like the dark green color as it doesn't stand out too much. An integrated water filter is much more convenient that a stupid pump when I'm in a hurry.
customer_reviews.author: JustSaying

customer_reviews.title: a must if you travel
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I bought these for our trip to India. We were able to stay hydrated on very hot days drinking the local water with these and not get sick. it filtered out all the bad stuff. worth every penny! saved money from not having to buy bottled water or soft drinks. If your going to a different country you need one of these!
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Real money saver!
customer_reviews.text: “It’s pink” - my wife She likes pink so she probably would have been satisfied with a red solo cup and a can of pink spray paint, but this way her water is filtered which should keep her more healthy and lower my healthcare costs.
customer_reviews.author: Chism Fink

customer_reviews.title: Be careful buying this online
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Water tasted awful even after multiple uses. I also felt sick after drinking from it I ended up switching back to bottled water on my trip and then felt much better. I feel I got a knock off version or a fake filter in it. Be careful buying this type of item on line.
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take to Cuba where the water is not recommended for drinking. It worked great. Now I use it for water at work because the water there has a bad taste and water bottles are too expensive - never mind what they do to the landfill and environment. It would be difficult to get under a water fountain though. Very well made and worth the price if you usually drink bottled water. Will pay for itself in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Paranzino

customer_reviews.title: worth it
customer_reviews.text: this waterbottle just got me through my trip to thailand! only complaint was in the airplane and while going through the mountains- opening it after pressure changes caused the water to spray everywhere. just watch out for it lol. don’t know if it’s easy to clean but looks pretty hard to do. left it in a hotel in phi phi 😭
customer_reviews.author: Marissa S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice bottle, but Leaks when filter is not in place
customer_reviews.text: There are times when I am using the bottle for normal use and do not need the filter, so I like to remove the filter if I am using known good filtered water. When the filter is not installed, The bottle will leak near the "straw" hinge if you place the bottle on it's side or upside down. Other than that, the bottle if super nice. The filter within the bottle is detachable, so you can replace it with ease when needed. Overall, I liked it, and I used the bottle throughout my costa rica visit. I just couldn't keep the bottle on its side.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The water never tasted clean like my previous water filtration bottle. Very disappointed in this product! I called the company when I was not able to “blow air through the filter to keep it clean and prevent clogging.” The woman didn’t seem too concerned snot that which from the instructions seemed to be fairly important. I have owned this bottle less than 2 months and used it mainly bedside so it can’t be used up. I have gone over and over the instructions which are straight forward and simple. I can’t find anything wrong. Since I have return time to pass I will try the second filter and see if the results are better. Such a disappointing experience.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah A. Donohue

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t help the taste of the water
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the taste improvement, and it didn’t do anything. The water tasted the same. I was looking for a water bottle I could take with me to a hotel so I wouldn’t need to buy water at target. But this just didn’t help the tast.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Fox

customer_reviews.title: It WORKED GREAT for me!!
customer_reviews.text: I used it while traveling through India for the past 3 weeks and I did not get sick at all!!! I would STRONGLY encourage anyone who plans to use this system overseas, or here in the states, to PRACTICE first. I had read the comments & followed one suggestion; to remove & repackage the carbon filter. I had NO PROBLEMS with leakage or drinking through the straw.
customer_reviews.author: shoegal

customer_reviews.title: I really like it, but I got it for international travel ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like it, but I got it for international travel and I'm disappointed that there is no cap to cover the straw part to keep it clean. My bottle lived in the water bottle pocket of my backpack for a month of travel and the top got dirty from dust, rain, bumping up against things, etc. It didn't feel very sanitary to drink from it by putting my mouth on a dirty straw. A cap to keep the straw and lid clean would really be appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Dolan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent water bottle!
customer_reviews.text: We took this on a 3 week long trip to the Mediterranean and highly recommend this product. We didn't have to purchase any bottled water at any of the countries we visited - we filled the bottle with water from the tap and was confident that our drinking water was safe (e.g. we never got sick hydrating ourselves with water from this LifeStraw).
customer_reviews.author: TheWOhana

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I order the two pack with the blue and purple. They came in fine and on time, but it only came with 1 carbon filter. I didnt see that in the description, so I had to order more replacements. Also, water slowly makes it way out of the straw and leaks onto the lid. If you don't notice the water that has somehow managed to accumulate onto the lid, it will spill everywhere. A little hard to drink from, but I expected that due to the filters.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Venable

customer_reviews.title: Say Yes to LifeStraw!
customer_reviews.text: Let’s get real - we throw way too much plastic into our landfills and it’s got to stop. I may not be using it in rivers, but I have used it while traveling in Cuba and Mexico and filled it with the water from public bathroom sinks, and I did not get sick. I also use it in hotels in the same way. Why spend $5 or $7 for a plastic bottle? This is a must for travel and for every day at your home, office or school!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Morrissey

product_meta.title: LifeStraw Go Water Filter Bottles
product_meta.description: Safe water on the go. LifeStraw Go uses 2-stage filtration within this refillable water bottle, so you have safe drinking water wherever you go. Now with a carbon capsule that reduces chlorine and other bad tastes. Removes 99.9999% of waterborne bacteria, including E-Coli; Removes 99.9% of waterborne protozoan parasites, including Giardia & Cryptosporidium; Activated carbon capsule reduces chlorine and other bad tastes; BPA-free Tritan bottle; Uses replacement filter and replacement activated carbon capsule for years of use; Filtration lifetime hollow fiber membrane: 1,000 liters (264 gallons); Lifetime activated carbon capsule: 100 liters (26 gallons); Replaceable? Yes; Dimensions: 9"L x 3"W.; Capacity: 22 oz.; Weight: 6 oz.; Mfg. Number: LSGOV2CR45; Lifestraw Go with 2-Stage Filtration
feature_bullets: Reusable LifeStraw Go BPA-free water bottle filters water while drinking; great for travel, backpacking, camping, and emergency kits
Award-winning LifeStraw hollow fiber membrane water filter removes bacteria and protozoa from lakes, streams to ensure safe, clean drinking water
2-stage activated carbon filter reduces odor, chlorine and leaves zero aftertaste
Removes 99.9999% of waterborne bacteria, and 99.9% of waterborne protozoan parasites without chemicals, iodine or batteries
Durable, 23-ounce, leak-proof bottle made of BPA-free Tritan and features a food-grade silicone mouthpiece; replacement filters available separately

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
